title: Add brownfield support to project-init command
description:
## Context
The project-init command currently only handles greenfield (new project) scenarios. Many users will want to add beads to existing projects without disrupting their current setup.

## Problem
Current behavior:
- Overwrites existing config files (package.json, pyproject.toml, etc.)
- Replaces existing CLAUDE.md
- Errors on existing .beads directory
- No project type detection

## Requirements

### 1. Project Type Detection
Detect existing project type from files:
- `package.json` → typescript/javascript
- `pyproject.toml` or `setup.py` → python
- `go.mod` → go
- `Cargo.toml` → rust
- None → standard

### 2. New Flags
- `--existing` or `-e`: Run in brownfield mode (current directory)
- `--beads-only`: Only add beads, skip all templates
- `--merge`: Merge with existing files instead of overwrite
- `--no-overwrite`: Skip any file that already exists

### 3. Selective File Handling
| File | Greenfield | Brownfield |
|------|------------|------------|
| .beads/ | Create | Create if missing |
| .gitignore | Create | Append beads entries |
| CLAUDE.md | Create | Append beads section |
| package.json | Create | Skip (preserve) |
| pyproject.toml | Create | Skip (preserve) |
| README.md | Create | Skip (preserve) |

### 4. CLAUDE.md Merge
If CLAUDE.md exists, append beads workflow section instead of replacing:
```markdown
<!-- Existing content preserved -->

## Beads Issue Tracking
<!-- Beads section appended -->
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `/project-init . --existing` works in existing repo
- [ ] `/project-init . --beads-only` only adds .beads/
- [ ] Existing files are preserved by default
- [ ] .gitignore gets beads entries appended
- [ ] CLAUDE.md gets beads section appended
- [ ] Project type auto-detected from existing files
